page.title: 09FAMILY LIFE IN THE EIGHTIES
page.content: My family is a family of five, my sister, my brother, my dad, my mum and me. I share a bedroom with my sister. We have got bunk beds by the window and the wardrobe opposite. I sleep on the top bunk. My Mum has a phone that we can all use if we pay for the call. We also have three rooms downstairs. One is a dining room with a table and chairs and a piano which my sister plays. Then there is my living room which has a settee and two armchairs. We have a television in there. There is a computer which everybody uses apart from my mum. My dad has got all his tape recorders and record players in there too. We have got a lot of things in that room. Then we have the kitchen. The things we do together are playing games in the living room like 'Scrabble'.
